cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 60 mi (95 km) SW of Ponce, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, expected to cross Hispaniola tonight, skirt eastern Cuba Sunday, and eventually enter the Gulf of Mexico toward the north-central Gulf Coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Central Bahamas; Cuban provinces of Las Tunas, Holguín, Guantánamo, Santiago de Cuba, and Granma
weather_observation.warning_coast: Puerto Rico (including Vieques & Culebra), U.S. Virgin Islands, northern & southern coasts of the Dominican Republic, northern coast of Haiti, southeastern Bahamas, Turks & Caicos
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Puerto Rico, Virgin Islands, Hispaniola, eastern Cuba, Turks & Caicos, Bahamas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds of 40–60 mph expected across Puerto Rico, including San Juan, through this evening.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None (only rough surf and minor coastal inundation possible)
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain of 3–6 inches with isolated 8 inches likely; risk of flash flooding and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along exposed coasts
